### Advance Procurement Notice
#### Building Development, Design and Construction/Renovation
 Sherbrooke, Quebec
  Estimated Contract Value: CAD 250,000,000.00 or more
### Overview
The Government of Canada's Department of National Defence intends to advance its procurement process for the construction, development, and renovation of a building project in Sherbrooke, Quebec. This Advance Procurement Notice (APN) aims to provide interested consultants or contractors with early access to the sponsorship request process for a security clearance that may be required for the project. Please note that there is no guarantee that this project will be awarded or that a security clearance will be granted in a timely manner.

### Project Description
The project involves the relocation of various units at several sites in Sherbrooke, Quebec. One building, recognized by the Federal Heritage Buildings Review Office, and one building with historical significance to the City of Sherbrooke, are part of the project sites. The consultant or contractor team must include a heritage expert to ensure compliance with applicable regulations. The estimated contract value exceeds CAD 250,000,000.00.

### Security Clearance Requirements
To be considered for contract award, the consultant or contractor must hold a valid and active DESIGNATED ORGANIZATION SCREENING (DOS) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP) of Public Works and Government Services Canada (TPSGC) at the time of contract closing. Interested consultants or contractors without the required security clearance should begin the application process by applying for sponsorship through the Industrial Security Program (ISP) of Defence Construction Canada (DCC).

### Solicitation Timeline
The solicitation is expected to be initiated in the spring of 2023, and the project is conditional on contract approval by the Department of National Defence.
